definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Cameron held a grand welcome ceremony for Wen prior to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 會談前，卡梅倫爲溫家寶舉行了隆重的歡迎儀式。

sentences.english: But Cameron, watching from the Opposition benches, took it all in.
sentences.chinese: 但從反對派來看，卡梅倫接受了這一切。

sentences.english: Cameron strikes a Churchillian tone when he talks about the nation’s austerity plans.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅倫在談到國家的緊縮計劃時用的是丘吉爾的論調。

sentences.english: He added the talks at his country retreat covered a variety of subjects.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅倫說，在他鄉間別墅的會談涉及了一系列的問題。

sentences.english: Open-Web and free-speech advocates immediately objected to Cameron's language.
sentences.chinese: 網絡開放和言論自由的支持者迅速反對卡梅倫的言論。

sentences.english: Mr Cameron has striven to make it so.
sentences.chinese: 這正是卡梅倫先生想要看到的，他也曾爲此而努力。

sentences.english: And what of his chances in the general election expected next month?
sentences.chinese: 那麼卡梅倫在下個月的大選中勝出的可能性有多大呢？

sentences.english: They married in 1996 and Mrs Cameron is now 5 months pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 1996年與卡梅倫結婚，目前懷有5個月身孕。

sentences.english: Despite doubts about the action itself, most praised Prime Minister David Cameron.
sentences.chinese: 儘管對行動本身存在質疑，但多數人稱讚首相卡梅倫。

sentences.english: His accomplishment has been to make them electable.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅倫的成就使得託利黨又有了候選資格。

sentences.english: This would have been a centre-left landslide, with Cameron humiliated.
sentences.chinese: 其結果會是中間偏左的政黨大勝，卡梅倫蒙羞。

sentences.english: Mr. Cameron conceded that in hindsight it had been a mistake to hire Mr. Coulson.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅倫事後承認，聘用庫爾森是一個錯誤。

sentences.english: The prime minister says he's determined to take on long-standing social problems.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅倫表示他決心解決積存已久的社會問題。

sentences.english: This is the complexion of the “big choice” that Mr Brown and Mr Cameron are touting.
sentences.chinese: 這便是布朗和卡梅倫兜售的“大抉擇”的情況。

sentences.english: Alone, but I'd also like to get to know Cameron.
sentences.chinese: 孤獨，但我還希望去了解卡梅倫。

sentences.english: A second group of winners includes Nicolas Sarkozy, David Cameron and Barack Obama.
sentences.chinese: 一個第二組的獲獎者包括薩科齊，卡梅倫和奧巴馬。

definition: François Hollande (1954-), French Socialist politician, president of France 2012-2017
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Wei3 yuan2 hui4

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
